meanings.sent1: The old, dusty attic felt even unholier when the light flickered.
meanings.sent2: The abandoned house had an unholier atmosphere than the church.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to find the unholier corners of the house to hide in.
meanings.sent4: The unholier whispers of the wind made the trees seem eerie and haunted.
meanings.sent5: The unholier presence in the room sent shivers down my spine.

meanings.definition: More evil or sinful than something else
meanings.sent1: The villain's plan to harm the innocent was even unholier than expected.
meanings.sent2: The unholier deeds of the criminal shocked the entire town.
meanings.sent3: The unholier actions of the character in the story led to their downfall.
meanings.sent4: The unholier intentions behind the smile sent a chill down my spine.
meanings.sent5: The unholier nature of the crime left a stain on the community.
